ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English, derived from Old English forma, the superlative of fore 'before, in front of'.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Existing or occurring in time past; preceding in time; having previously been (the thing specified).
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The former capital of the country was moved due to frequent flooding.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 由于经常发生洪水，该国的前任首都已被迁移。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Referring to the first of two things or people mentioned.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Between the novel and the play, the former is much more gripping.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 在小说和戏剧之间，前者更引人入胜。
